newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: German tourist killed by S.African robbers.
newsitem.headline: German tourist killed by S.African robbers.

text.p: A German tourist in South Africa died on Wednesday after being stabbed by four robbers while sightseeing in Pretoria at the weekend.
"Eckard Franz, 55...was stabbed twice in the back with a sharp object," police spokesman Captain Morne van Wyk said. He died in hospital. His wife was unharmed.
Van Wyk said police did not know where the couple's hometown was, and no arrests had been made for the attack in which Franz was robbed of his belongings.
Last month German business leaders based in South Africa called on the government to crack down on violent crime or risk losing future investment.
They spoke up after car hijackers shot dead Erich Ellmer, German financial director of the AEG electronics group in South Africa, outside his Johannesburg home.
"The level of personal danger endured by managers and the community at large is totally unacceptable," the South African-German Chamber of Commerce and Industry said.
It said 16 of the 30 chief executives of German subsidiaries in the country had been victims of violent crime.
Germany, Britain and the United States are South Africa's three biggest trading partners and most tourists also come from these countries.

South Africa is one of the world's most crime-ridden societies. Nearly two million serious crimes were reported last year, including 36,888 rapes, 18,983 murders and 66,838 armed robberies. Only half were solved.
